## Description {#details}

Mass of a block.

This class implements a sort of fixed-point fraction always between 0.0 and 1.0. <a href="#a221f01eee80db0b0c4f4567c84b54fb5">getMass()</a> == std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;::max() indicates a value of 1.0.

Masses can be added and subtracted. Simple saturation arithmetic is used, so arithmetic operations never overflow or underflow.

Masses can be multiplied. Multiplication treats full mass as 1.0 and uses an inexpensive floating-point algorithm that&#39;s off-by-one (almost, but not quite, maximum precision).

Masses can be scaled by <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobability">BranchProbability</a></em> at maximum precision.

Definition at line 92 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>.

### toScaled() {#af48ed4af672b3ec628c6c79ac0746312}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScaledNumber&lt; uint64&#95;t &gt; BlockMass::toScaled () const</>}>
Convert to scaled number.

Convert to <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalednumber">ScaledNumber</a></em>. <em><a href="#a3d943c4e8129a1812f0ddbe60766caf7">isFull()</a></em> gives 1.0, while <em><a href="#a3874be041c63e0b867d82331409a0de2">isEmpty()</a></em> gives slightly above 0.0.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h/#l00147">147</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-cpp/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-cpp">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.cpp</a>.
